cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.CR, cs.PL, cs.SE. 

The paper presents a systematic technique for transforming XACML 3.0 policies into Answer Set Programming (ASP), which is a logic programming paradigm that has been extensively used in artificial intelligence (cs.AI) and logic (cs.LO) research. The paper also discusses how the resulting logic program can be used to verify properties of access control policies, which is a topic related to computer security (cs.CR). Additionally, the paper involves the use of formal methods to verify properties of policies, which is a topic related to programming languages (cs.PL) and software engineering (cs.SE).
